attributes.action: remove the disparity in the minimum wage for young people and agree that the same rate (ie £5.52 per hour) applies to ALL age groups
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The current structure of the minimum wage agreement is unfair. Currently, workers aged 22 or over can expect a minimum wage of £5.52 per hour, whilst those aged 18 – 21 can only expect £4.60 – and those aged 16-17 years old can only anticipate a minimum of £3.40. Whether you are 17 or 62, an hour's work deserves the protection of the same minimum wage, ie £5.52 per hour.  This is an issue that is being pursued by the British Youth Council and this petition supports their endeavours.
